CatDescriptText: Eddie Bryant, tanner, Milwaukee, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 18, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "If you were granted an audience with Nikita Khrushchev, what would you say to him?" answer reads: "I would talk to him about the blast. I would tell him that he should disband the tests, because it is destructive to the people."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Eddie Bryant wearing moustache, fedora, and light colored overcoat buttoned to neck, standing in front of clapboard building
